TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SessionParameter extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter

Docs.summary: Binds the value of a session variable to a parameter object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A `SessionParameter` object is typically used in order to include the value of an <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState> variable in the `Where` clause of a database query. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property identifies the session variable from which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> retrieves a value.
> [!NOTE] > Controls that bind data to a parameter by using a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object might throw an exception if the specified session variable is not set. To avoid this error (where appropriate), set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property.
## Examples The following example shows how to use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object. The example assumes that another page has stored an employee ID value in a session variable named `empid`. The example page uses the `empid` session variable in the `Where` clause of a query and displays the result of the query in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object is set to 5, data for the record that has the `employeeID` value of 5 will still be displayed if no session variable named `empid` is set before you run the example.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl/CS/webform21cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl/VB/webform21vb.aspx#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new unnamed instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor is initialized with default values for all its properties. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>. Additionally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.TypeCode.Object?displayProperty=nameWithType>, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Direction%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Data.ParameterDirection.Input?displayProperty=nameWithType>, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is initialized to `null`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a default instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2/CS/sessionparam2cs.aspx.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2/VB/sessionparam2vb.aspx.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter%29> constructor is a `Protected` copy constructor used to clone a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> instance. The values of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Type%2A> properties, are all transferred to the new instance.

## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object and use it with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control to display data in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.

Docs.param: A that is associated with the Web Forms page where the is used.
Docs.summary: Updates and returns the value of the object.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the updated and current value of the parameter. If the context or the request is , the method returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object attempts to bind to the value of the session variable every time the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method is called.
The `context` parameter is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method to retrieve the name/value pair that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object binds to. The `control` parameter is ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ SessionField { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.SessionField : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the session variable that the parameter binds to.
Docs.value: A string that identifies the that the parameter binds to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property identifies a name/value pair that is stored in the current session object associated with the Web browser. While the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property identifies the name of the pair, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> binds to its corresponding value at run time. If the expected session string name/value pair is not found in the session, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method binds the parameter to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property, if it is set. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> property is not set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.Evaluate%2A> method fails to bind the parameter to a value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to declaratively create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object, set its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter.DefaultValue%2A> properties, and add it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.SelectParameters%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control displays the results of the SQL query submitted by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl/CS/webform21cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_1_decl/VB/webform21vb.aspx#1)]
The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter.SessionField%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter> object.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2/CS/sessionparam2cs.aspx.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.WebControls.SessionParameter_2/VB/sessionparam2vb.aspx.vb#1)]
